first_reading.text:
[[Ac 1,15]]Peter stood up in the midst of the brothers (there was a group of about one hundred and twenty persons in the one place). He said,
[[Ac 1,16]]"My brothers, the scripture had to be fulfilled which the holy Spirit spoke beforehand through the mouth of David, concerning Judas, who was the guide for those who arrested Jesus.
[[Ac 1,17]]He was numbered among us and was allotted a share in this ministry.
[[Ac 1,20a]]For it is written in the Book of Psalms: 'Let his encampment become desolate, and may no one dwell in it.'
[[Ac 1,20c]]And: 'May another take his office.'
[[Ac 1,21]]Therefore, it is necessary that one of the men who accompanied us the whole time the Lord Jesus came and went among us,
[[Ac 1,22]]beginning from the baptism of John until the day on which he was taken up from us, become with us a witness to his resurrection."
[[Ac 1,23]]So they proposed two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was also known as Justus, and Matthias.
[[Ac 1,24]]Then they prayed, "You, Lord, who know the hearts of all, show which one of these two you have chosen
[[Ac 1,25]]to take the place in this apostolic ministry from which Judas turned away to go to his own place."
[[Ac 1,26]]Then they gave lots to them, and the lot fell upon Matthias, and he was counted with the eleven apostles.
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles

psalm.text:
[[Ps 103,1]]Bless the LORD, O my soul; 
and all my being, bless his holy name.
[[Ps 103,2]]Bless the LORD, O my soul, 
and forget not all his benefits.

[[Ps 103,11]]For as the heavens are high above the earth, 
so surpassing is his kindness toward those who fear him.
[[Ps 103,12]]As far as the east is from the west, 
so far has he put our transgressions from us.

[[Ps 103,19]]The LORD has established his throne in heaven, 
and his kingdom rules over all.
[[Ps 103,20a]]Bless the LORD, all you his angels,
[[Ps 103,20b]]you mighty in strength, who do his bidding.
psalm.title: Psalms

second_reading.text:
[[1_Jn 4,11]]Beloved, if God so loved us, we also must love one another.
[[1_Jn 4,12]]No one has ever seen God. Yet, if we love one another, God remains in us, and his love is brought to perfection in us.
[[1_Jn 4,13]]This is how we know that we remain in him and he in us, that he has given us of his Spirit.
[[1_Jn 4,14]]Moreover, we have seen and testify that the Father sent his Son as savior of the world.
[[1_Jn 4,15]]Whoever acknowledges that Jesus is the Son of God, God remains in him and he in God.
[[1_Jn 4,16]]We have come to know and to believe in the love God has for us. God is love, and whoever remains in love remains in God and God in him.
second_reading.title: First Letter of John

gospel.text:
[[Jn 17,11b]]Lifting up his eyes to heaven, Jesus prayed, saying: "Holy Father, keep them in your name that you have given me, so that they may be one just as we are.
[[Jn 17,12]]When I was with them I protected them in your name that you gave me, and I guarded them, and none of them was lost except the son of destruction, in order that the scripture might be fulfilled.
[[Jn 17,13]]But now I am coming to you. I speak this in the world so that they may share my joy completely.
[[Jn 17,14]]I gave them your word, and the world hated them, because they do not belong to the world any more than I belong to the world.
[[Jn 17,15]]I do not ask that you take them out of the world but that you keep them from the evil one.
[[Jn 17,16]]They do not belong to the world any more than I belong to the world.
[[Jn 17,17]]Consecrate them in the truth. Your word is truth.
[[Jn 17,18]]As you sent me into the world, so I sent them into the world.
[[Jn 17,19]]And I consecrate myself for them, so that they also may be consecrated in truth."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
